tr.td: Vaccinia virus strain Lister Elstree (ATCC VR‐1549)

td.p: Cons: only inactivates lipid viruses, flammable, requires specific concentration range to be effective,

tr.td: Vaccinia virus strain Lister Elstree (ATCC VR‐1549)
Odorless, colorless, and non‐caustic. Requires warmer temperatures and longer reaction time. Virucidal activity reduced by the presence of contaminating organic matter.
Murine Hepatitis Virus (Strains MHV‐2 and MHV‐N)
Odorless, colorless, and non‐caustic. Requires warmer temperatures and longer reaction time. Virucidal effects unaffected by organic load.
Mono; bis (tri‐methyl ammonium methylene chloride)‐alkyl (C 9‐15) toluene
Odorless, colorless, and non‐caustic. Requires warmer temperatures and longer reaction time. Virucidal effects unaffected by organic load.
Usually used as a foaming agent in kitchen detergents for routine cleaning
Low cost. Virucidal effects reduced by organic load. Sensitive to water hardness.
High cytotoxicity and spermicidal, dilutions by >500 times required
High cytotoxicity and spermicidal, dilutions by >500 times required
Lower cytotoxicity as compared to amide or ester bearing non‐ionic surfactants
Lower cytotoxicity, formulation can be used without dilution
Lower cytotoxicity as compared to amide or ester bearing non‐ionic surfactants

Long‐lasting slow release of iodine, fast acting, more effective than many other disinfectants.
Low skin irritability, safe, good skin persistence

Handwashes, mouthwashes and oral gels, disinfectants in hospitals
142
Ineffective against non‐enveloped viruses. Less potent and slower‐acting than povidone‐iodine
Household disinfectants, cleaning of hospital surgical equipment
Can cause skin irritation, highly toxic to aquatic organisms
Carcinogenic and irritant. Needs to be used in a well‐ventilated area.
irritant. Needs to be used in a well‐ventilated area.
Clinical settings only, not suitable for household disinfection

td.p: Cons: hazardous to health, deactivates by polymerization in alkaline media with time
Non‐flammable. Irritation to mucous membranes at high concentrations. Low incidence of serious toxicity.
Toxic chlorine gas produced when mixed with acid

tr.td: Cleaning and disinfection in hospitals, removing blood stain contamination

td.p: Pros: Broad spectrum, no toxic residues, fast‐acting
Cons: Corrosive to metals at high concentrations, Decreased activity in the presence of organic matter
Pros: Broad‐spectrum, fast‐acting, long shelf life, easy to ship
Cons: Strong smell, Some decrease in activity in the presence of organic matter,
Pros: Fast acting, leaves no residue, still effective in organic matter

fn.p: Abbreviations: AT, unspecified ambient temperature; RT, room temperature.
Values given as log 10 reduction factors unless otherwise specified.
